intro: Ruellia aromatica, commonly known as sweet rosel, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers, which range in color from blue to purple, are attractive to pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Ruellia aromatica is often cultivated for its ornamental value and can thrive in a variety of soil types with adequate moisture.
